contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox MLB player |name=Robert Machado |position=[[Catcher]] |bats=Right |throws=Right |birth_date={{Birth date and age|1973|6|3}} |birth_place=[[Carabobo State|Puerto Cabello, Carabobo State]], [[Venezuela]] |debutdate=July 24 |debutyear={{By|1996}} |debutteam=[[Chicago White Sox]] |finaldate=September 18 |finalyear={{By|2004}} |finalteam=[[Baltimore Orioles]] |stat1label=[[Batting average]] |stat1value=.230 |stat2label=[[Home run]]s |stat2value=11 |stat3label=[[Run batted in|Runs batted in]]| |stat3value=61| |teams=<nowiki></nowiki><!--This forces MediaWiki to recognize the first bullet. Kind of a workaround to a bug.--> *[[Chicago White Sox]] ({{By|1996}}–{{By|1998}}) *[[Montreal Expos]] ({{By|1999}}) *[[Seattle Mariners]] ({{By|2000}}) *[[Chicago Cubs]] ({{By|2001}}–{{By|2002}}) *[[Milwaukee Brewers]] ({{By|2002}}) *[[Baltimore Orioles]] ({{By|2003}}–{{By|2004}}) }} '''Robert Alexis Machado''' [ma-CHAH-do] (born June 3, 1973 in [[Carabobo State|Puerto Cabello, Carabobo State]], [[Venezuela]]) is a former [[catcher]] in [[Major League Baseball]] who played most recently with the [[Texas Rangers (baseball)|Texas Rangers]] organization. Previously, Machado played for the [[Chicago White Sox]] ({{By|1996}}-{{By|1998}}), [[Montreal Expos]] ({{By|1999}}), [[Seattle Mariners]] ({{By|2000}}), [[Chicago Cubs]] ({{By|2001}}-{{By|2002}}), [[Milwaukee Brewers]] (2002), and [[Baltimore Orioles]] ({{By|2003}}-{{By|2004}}). He batted and threw [[right-handed]]. Machado was a solid defensive catcher with a strong arm, but his little offensive value limited his effectiveness as an everyday player. His most productive season came in 2001 with the Cubs, when he posted a .997 of [[fielding percentage]] and threw out 13 of 39 baserunners who attempted to [[stolen base|steal]] off him. He also had eight multi-hit games, including three over a six-game span, when he went 9-for-23 with three [[Double (baseball)|doubles]] and a [[home run]]. In a nine-year career, Machado was a .230 hitter with 11 home runs and 61 RBI in 230 games. Machado received a 15-game suspension for violating Major League Baseball's minor-league drug treatment and prevention program.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.baseballamerica.com/today/news/050404steroids.html |title=38 Suspended For Steroids |accessdate=2009-02-02|last=Manuel |first=John |date=2005-04-04 |publisher=[[Baseball America]]}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Baseballstats|br=m/macharo01|fangraphs=289|cube=robert-machado}} * [http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/players/profile?statsId=5660 ESPN profile and daily updates] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Machado, Robert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Venezuelan baseball player | DATE OF BIRTH = June 3, 1973 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Carabobo State|Puerto Cabello, Carabobo State]], [[Venezuela]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Machado, Robert}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chicago White Sox players]] [[Category:Montreal Expos players]] [[Category:Seattle Mariners players]] [[Category:Chicago Cubs players]] [[Category:Milwaukee Brewers players]] [[Category:Baltimore Orioles players]] [[Category:American sportspeople in doping cases]] [[Category:Baseball players suspended for drug offenses]] [[Category:Major League Baseball catchers]] [[Category:Major League Baseball players from Venezuela]] [[Category:People from Puerto Cabello]] [[Category:Gulf Coast White Sox players]] [[Category:Utica Blue Sox players]] [[Category:South Bend White Sox players]] [[Category:Prince William Cannons players]] [[Category:Nashville Sounds players]] [[Category:Birmingham Barons players]] [[Category:Calgary Cannons players]] [[Category:Charlotte Knights players]] [[Category:Ottawa Lynx players]] [[Category:Tacoma Rainiers players]] [[Category:Iowa Cubs players]]
